path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/Hybrid Doge V2 Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf.pdf

findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The function addLiTXidiW allows minting an unlimited number of Sundae tokens without any checks.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The finding suggests that there might be a potential unauthorized script upgrade due to the lack of proper access control or validation mechanisms.

findings.title: Unprotected function call
findings.description: The unprotected function call can be exploited to gain unauthorized access and manipulate the contract's state.

findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability
findings.description: The contract can be re-entered by calling the function recursively, leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unsecured use of _NAME and _SYMBOL
findings.description: The variables _NAME and _SYMBOL are used without proper initialization or validation.

findings.title: Insecure use of addUeVV URXWeUAddUeVV
findings.description: The function uses addUeVV URXWeUAddUeVV without proper validation, which can lead to insecure operations.

findings.title: Insecure use of feeaddUeVV
findings.description: The insecure use of feeaddUeVV can cause precision loss and failure of certain checks.

findings.title: Unprotected access to _W[Fee
findings.description: The variable _W[Fee is accessible without any protection or restriction.

findings.title: Unvalidated user input in e[cOXdeFURPFee
findings.description: The function does not validate user input, which can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Potential reentrancy in iQcOXdeIQReZaUd
findings.description: The function may allow reentrancy attacks by modifying the array state and making external calls.

findings.title: Unsecured use of accRXQW
findings.description: The unsecured use of accRXQW can cause precision loss and lead to failure of _withdrawHealthCheck.

findings.title: Insecure use of _iVE[cOXded[accRXQW]
findings.description: The function uses an insecure method to check and update the array '_e[cOXded' which can cause issues.

findings.title: Unprotected access to _WOZQed[accRXQW]
findings.description: The unprotected access to _WOZQed[accRXQW] can cause issues as it is not properly checked or validated.
